flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: Using engine blocks as big Lego blocks is the machine starting point. Since cylinder bores are bored parallel to each other and at exact right angles to the cylinder head surface, MultiMachine accuracy begins at the factory where the engine block was built and if care is taken during construction, an extremely accurate all purpose machine tool will result.

lines.text: The machine is made of 5 modules that attach to a vehicle engine block         1 The vertical slide         2 The drive unit         3 Mounting the machine         4 The overarm         5 The spindle
lines.text_raw: The machine is made of 5 modules that attach to a vehicle engine block         1 The vertical slide         2 The drive unit         3 Mounting the machine         4 The overarm         5 The spindle

lines.text: (1) The vertical slide module is basically a short engine block with a steel plate bolted to the head surface and a cross slide attached  to  to the end bell (upper) end. There are many kinds of cross slides that can be bought or built. If you have a little money to spend, think about buying a $69 ENCO one to use at first (in developing countries, however, a similar one may be the equivalent of a thousand dollars).

lines.text: . Later, you can build something like a massive concrete and steel “Romig” single or twin lathe bed and cross slide. (See the “Romig” turret lathe design in the MultiMachine newsgroup “files” section.)  J.V. Romig designed machine tools that were featured in Popular Mechanics magazine for almost thirty years. The designs still work well. This small cross slide also can be used for many other projects. Example: you can fit it on top of a turntable and use it for cutting tapers. (A turntable could also be fitted to the top of a big “Romig” bed to cut tapers.)

lines.text: (4) The overarm module may not even be needed by some people but others may see it as the heart of an entire tooling system. Because it is important that the overarm always stay in alignment, the #1 cylinder is re-bored to fit your overarm pipe at the same time the #3 cylinder is re-bored for the spindle.

lines.text: 5) The spindle module is the heart of the machine. No machine tool can do a proper job with an inaccurate spindle. Because the  bearings actually run in the professionally bored cylinder bore of the engine block and the spindle is finish-machined on the MultiMachine itself, accuracy is achievable even by a novice machinist. (To be treated in much more detail later)

guide.summary: The Multimachine first began life as as an attempt at building a horizontal milling machine but it soon became apparent that the machine could made to do almost every metal machining operation.
